Students will face with real life scenarios in hospitality industry. They will evaluate the role of employee benefits, the rights of employees and the various methods of employee compensation in retaining and motivating employees. Case studies will help students to examine current and future challenges and trends in human resource management.

Earners must receive an "A" grade from ESU Sport Management internship courses (SMGT 486 or SMGT 586). A minimum of 40 work hours per one academic credit must be completed (e.g., if a student takes 12-credits internship course, 480 work hours are required.)

alignments.name: Ethics and Porfessional Norms
alignments.description: Effective educational leaders act ethically and according to professional norms to promote each student’s academic success and well-being.

alignments.name: Leadership
alignments.description: The leadership of a quality online program is accountable to the program’s governance body and is responsible for setting and meeting the operational and strategic goals in support of the program’s mission and vision statements.

alignments.name: Integrity and Accountability
alignments.description: In a quality online program, leadership is transparent in its management of the program, providing regular and timely information on progress towards attainment of goals, alignment with policies and standards, and achievement of student learning outcomes to all stakeholders.

eaca02ba-7bb5-42aa-b4f3-249e9c8d5b6e.description: Earners of this badge have completed a 1.0 credit course focused on developing the mission, vision, and core values for their virtual schools/programs. Effective leaders develop, advocate, and enact a shared mission, vision, and core values to promote high-quality education, academic success, and the well-being of each student. Virtual learning environments offer unique opportunities and present unique challenges and require a specialized mission, vision, and core values.

alignments.name: Mission Vision and Core Values
alignments.description: Effective educational leaders develop, advocate, and enact a shared mission, vision, and core values of high-quality education and academic success and well-being of each student.

alignments.name: Mission Statement
alignments.description: A mission statement of a quality program clearly conveys its purpose and goals. It serves as the basis for the program’s day-to-day operations, as well as a guide for its strategic plans for the future. Communication between— and buy-in from—stakeholders is a critical component of a mission statement.
